mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="f_{i}(x,y)=\left\{\begin{array}[]{lll}(\frac{x}{2},\frac{y}{2})&\mbox{if $i=1$%
}\\
f_{1}(x,y)+(\frac{1}{2},0)&\mbox{if $i=2$}\\
f_{1}(x,y)+(\frac{1}{4},\frac{1}{2})&\mbox{if $i=3$,}\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mtext>if </mtext><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd/></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mtext>if </mtext><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd/></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mtext>if </mtext><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mtext>,</mtext></mrow></mtd><mtd/></mtr></mtable><mi/></mrow></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{\rm dim\,}_{B}(F)=\lim_{\delta\rightarrow 0}\frac{\log N_{\delta}(F)}{-\log%
\delta}," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><munder><mo movablelimits="false">lim</mo><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mo>⁡</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mi>δ</mi></msub></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>δ</mi></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: We would like also to point out that the next limit always exists:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex3.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{H}_{\delta}^{s}(F)={\rm inf}\Bigg{\{}\sum_{j\in J}{\rm diam\,}(U_{j})%
^{s}:\{U_{j}\}_{j\in J}\in\mathcal{C}_{\delta}(F)\Bigg{\}}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mi>δ</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>inf</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">{</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>J</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>diam</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>s</mi></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>:</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>J</mi></mrow></msub><mo>∈</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒞</mi><mi>δ</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext:
which is called the $s$-dimensional Hausdorff measure of $F$. 

Hence, the Hausdorff dimension of $F$ is fully determined as the point $s$ where $\mathcal{H}_H^s(F)$ ``jumps" from $\infty$ to $0$, namely,
prevtext: We would like also to point out that the next limit always exists:
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex4.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{H}_{H}^{s}(F)=\lim_{\delta\rightarrow 0}\mathcal{H}_{\delta}^{s}(F)," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><munder><mo movablelimits="false">lim</mo><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mi>δ</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext:
which is called the $s$-dimensional Hausdorff measure of $F$. 

Hence, the Hausdorff dimension of $F$ is fully determined as the point $s$ where $\mathcal{H}_H^s(F)$ ``jumps" from $\infty$ to $0$, namely,
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex5.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{\rm dim\,}_{H}(F)={\rm inf}\{s:\mathcal{H}_{H}^{s}(F)=0\}=\sup\{s:\mathcal{H}%
_{H}^{s}(F)=\infty\}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mi>H</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>inf</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>:</mo><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo movablelimits="false">sup</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>:</mo><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: \item the (lower/upper) fractal dimension II for $F$ is defined as the (lower/upper) limit:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex6.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{\rm dim\,}_{{\mathbf{\Gamma}}}^{1}(F)=\lim_{n\rightarrow\infty}\frac{\log N_{%
n}(F)}{n\log 2}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mi>𝚪</mi><mn>1</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><munder><mo movablelimits="false">lim</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></mrow></munder><mo>⁡</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: \item the (lower/upper) fractal dimension II for $F$ is defined as the (lower/upper) limit:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex7.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{\rm dim\,}_{{\mathbf{\Gamma}}}^{2}(F)=\lim_{n\rightarrow\infty}\frac{\log N_{%
n}(F)}{-\log\delta(F,\Gamma_{n})}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mi>𝚪</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><munder><mo movablelimits="false">lim</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></mrow></munder><mo>⁡</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>δ</mi></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Γ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex8.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{H}_{n,k}^{s}(F)={\rm inf}\Bigg{\{}\sum_{j\in J}{\rm diam\,}(A_{j})^{s%
}:\{A_{j}\}_{j\in J}\in\mathcal{A}_{n,k}(F)\Bigg{\}}," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>inf</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">{</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>J</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>diam</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>s</mi></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>:</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>J</mi></mrow></msub><mo>∈</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒜</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: for $k\in \{3,4,5\}$, then the fractal dimension III (resp. IV, V) of $F$ is defined as the non-negative real such that
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex9.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{H}_{k}^{s}(F)=\lim_{n\rightarrow\infty}\mathcal{H}_{n,k}^{s}(F)," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mi>k</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><munder><mo movablelimits="false">lim</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></mrow></munder><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: \item Consider the following expression:
prevtext: for $k\in \{3,4,5\}$, then the fractal dimension III (resp. IV, V) of $F$ is defined as the non-negative real such that
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex10.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{\rm dim\,}_{{\mathbf{\Gamma}}}^{k}(F)={\rm inf}\{s:\mathcal{H}_{k}^{s}(F)=0\}%
=\sup\{s:\mathcal{H}_{k}^{s}(F)=\infty\}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mi>𝚪</mi><mi>k</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>inf</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>:</mo><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mi>k</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo movablelimits="false">sup</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>:</mo><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mi>k</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: where for each $\delta>0$, the family $\mathcal{A}_{\delta,6}(F)$ is defined by
prevtext: \item Consider the following expression:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex11.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{H}_{\delta,6}^{s}(F)={\rm inf}\Bigg{\{}\sum_{j\in J}{\rm diam\,}(A_{j%
})^{s}:\{A_{j}\}_{j\in J}\in\mathcal{A}_{\delta,6}(F)\Bigg{\}}," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>inf</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">{</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>J</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>diam</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>s</mi></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>:</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>J</mi></mrow></msub><mo>∈</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒜</mi><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: Thus, provided that
prevtext: where for each $\delta>0$, the family $\mathcal{A}_{\delta,6}(F)$ is defined by
text: $$\mathcal{A}_{\delta,6}(F)=\Bigg\{\{A_j\}_{j\in J}:A_j\in \bigcup_{l\in \mathbb{N}}\Gamma_l\ \forall \, j\in J, {\rm diam \,}(A_j)\leq \delta, F\subseteq \bigcup_{j\in J}A_j\Bigg\}.$$
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex12.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{A}_{\delta,6}(F)=\Bigg{\{}\{A_{j}\}_{j\in J}:A_{j}\in\bigcup_{l\in%
\mathbb{N}}\Gamma_{l}\ \forall\,j\in J,{\rm diam\,}(A_{j})\leq\delta,F%
\subseteq\bigcup_{j\in J}A_{j}\Bigg{\}}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒜</mi><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">{</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>J</mi></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>A</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>∈</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" mathsize="160%" movablelimits="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="true">⋃</mo><mrow><mi>l</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>ℕ</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mpadded width="+5pt"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Γ</mi><mi>l</mi></msub></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">∀</mo><mi>j</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>∈</mo><mi>J</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>diam</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>δ</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>⊆</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" mathsize="160%" movablelimits="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="true">⋃</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>J</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mi>A</mi><mi>j</mi></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">}</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: then the fractal dimension VI of $F$ is defined as
prevtext: Thus, provided that
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex13.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{H}_{6}^{s}(F)=\lim_{\delta\rightarrow 0}\mathcal{H}_{\delta,6}^{s}(F)," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mn>6</mn><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><munder><mo movablelimits="false">lim</mo><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: then the fractal dimension VI of $F$ is defined as
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex14.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{\rm dim\,}_{{\mathbf{\Gamma}}}^{6}(F)={\rm inf}\{s:\mathcal{H}_{6}^{s}(F)=0\}%
=\sup\{s:\mathcal{H}_{6}^{s}(F)=\infty\}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mi>𝚪</mi><mn>6</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>inf</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>:</mo><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mn>6</mn><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo movablelimits="false">sup</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>:</mo><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mn>6</mn><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\sum_{i=1}^{k}c_{i}^{s}=1." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>k</mi></munderover><msubsup><mi>c</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="{\rm dim\,}_{B}(K)={\rm dim\,}_{{\mathbf{\Gamma}}}^{2}(K)=\frac{-\log k}{\log c}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mi>𝚪</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: Accordingly, the following chain of inequalities holds:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E3.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\overline{{\rm dim\,}}_{{\mathbf{\Gamma}}}^{2}(K)\leq\overline{\lim}_{n%
\rightarrow\infty}\frac{\log N_{\varepsilon_{n}}(K)}{-\log\varepsilon_{n}}=%
\overline{{\rm dim\,}}_{B}(K)." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mover accent="true"><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mo>¯</mo></mover><mi>𝚪</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mo movablelimits="false">lim</mo><mo>¯</mo></mover><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></msub></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>ε</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mo>¯</mo></mover><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: Accordingly, the following chain of inequalities holds:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex15.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\underline{{\rm dim\,}}_{B}(K)\leq\underline{{\rm dim\,}}_{{\mathbf{\Gamma}}}^%
{2}(K)\leq\overline{{\rm dim\,}}_{{\mathbf{\Gamma}}}^{2}(K)\leq\overline{{\rm
dim%
\,}}_{B}(K)," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><munder accentunder="true"><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mo>¯</mo></munder><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mrow><msubsup><munder accentunder="true"><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mo>¯</mo></munder><mi>𝚪</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mrow><msubsup><mover accent="true"><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mo>¯</mo></mover><mi>𝚪</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>dim</mi></mpadded><mo>¯</mo></mover><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex16.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\sum_{i\in I}c_{i}^{s}=1." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>I</mi></mrow></munder><msubsup><mi>c</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex17.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{split}\displaystyle\mathcal{H}_{n,3}^{s}(K)&\displaystyle={\rm inf}%
\Bigg{\{}\sum_{A\in\Gamma_{m}}{\rm diam\,}(A)^{s}:m\geq n\Bigg{\}}\\
&\displaystyle={\rm inf}\Bigg{\{}\sum_{(i_{1},\ldots,i_{m})\in J_{m}}{\rm diam%
\,}(K_{i_{1}\ldots\,i_{m}})^{s}:m\geq n\Bigg{\}}\\
&\displaystyle={\rm inf}\Bigg{\{}\sum_{i_{1}\in I}c_{i_{1}}^{s}\,\ldots\,\sum_%
{i_{m}\in I}c_{i_{m}}^{s}\,{\rm diam\,}(K)^{s}:m\geq n\Bigg{\}},\end{split}" display="block"><mtable columnspacing="0pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>inf</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">{</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>∈</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Γ</mi><mi>m</mi></msub></mrow></munder><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>diam</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>s</mi></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>:</mo><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>≥</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>inf</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">{</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>i</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>i</mi><mi>m</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>∈</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mi>m</mi></msub></mrow></munder><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>diam</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><msub><mi>i</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>i</mi><mi>m</mi></msub></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>s</mi></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>:</mo><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>≥</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>inf</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">{</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>i</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>∈</mo><mi>I</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><msubsup><mi>c</mi><msub><mi>i</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mi>s</mi></msubsup></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><msub><mi>i</mi><mi>m</mi></msub><mo>∈</mo><mi>I</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><msubsup><mi>c</mi><msub><mi>i</mi><mi>m</mi></msub><mi>s</mi></msubsup></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>diam</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>s</mi></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>:</mo><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>≥</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow><mo maxsize="260%" <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex18.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{H}_{H}^{s}(K)\leq\mathcal{H}_{6}^{s}(K)\leq\mathcal{H}_{5}^{s}(K)\leq%
\mathcal{H}_{4}^{s}(K)\leq\mathcal{H}_{3}^{s}(K)," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mn>6</mn><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mn>5</mn><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mn>4</mn><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℋ</mi><mn>3</mn><mi>s</mi></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>
